text: everyone I'm James I'm from the cloud
enablement team at Geoscience Australia
and GA you might have seen Anton
Easton's eonni our CIO talking this
morning so you would have seen us in the
news about mh370 we were involved in the
in the collection of data for mh370 and
this is some of the visualization from
that so GA we've got around 650 staff
they're all really technical I've never
seen so many PhDs and all my life I'm
the only person in the room without a
PhD sometimes we've got about 48 on the
US accounts 45 as of today we added five
since these slides got made and we've
had a 400 percent growth rate in the
last two years now AWS spent so we're
creating new accounts all the time so
before I talk about this I'm going to
talk about how we used to create AWS
accounts and Blake kind of alluded to it
but I'm going to go through it in
excruciating detail because we had to do
this a lot so first you have to have a
credit card so that's already a massive
roadblock for a lot of bureaucracies so
some people have billing some people are
budget codes some people don't so have a
credit card have a unique group email
address this is also tough for a lot of
bureaucracies for us it involved raising
a ticket to helpdesk and having that
ticket sit in the exchange queue for
maybe two weeks while it got actioned
it's just a group email address it's not
high priority right you've got to enter
your contact details so your country of
origin your cell phone number your
favorite color your best friend's dog's
name or whatever you got to enter those
payment details you've got to enter a
CAPTCHA to prove you're not a robot and
then you've got to receive an automated
phone call from a robot because irony
you've got to handshake the consolidated
billing account so that's a manual
process from both sides as well so from
the person who's creating the account
and from the cloud team who owns the
consolidated billing account and then
you've got to manage the route
credentials including MFA does the
person who created the account do that
if so how do they get the credentials to
us is that on a post-it note I don't
know anyway the Kanban team owns all the
post-it notes
so our solution is self-service AWS
account creation and just for full
disclosure it's not self-service yet
we're still waiting on SSO on the s3
website so we're doing that without
connecting our IDP to Cognito but the
entire rest of the process is fully
automated it just needs one of us from
the cloud team to kick it off so what
does it look like so our solution
involves a user does my laser pointer
work maybe oh yeah
so I use it hits the route 53 a DNS RAF
if t3 directs them to their CloudFront
distribution and then cloud front
directs them to the s3 website the s3
website is what has the form they enter
all their details in the form and the
form hits the API gateway which invokes
a lambda function so the lambda function
has a bunch of bodo in there
Bodo calls the organization's api
creates a new account it then switches
roles into that account and creates the
first user and assigns them a temporary
password and the whole thing is in
terraform so like everything we're doing
at GA these days it's it's all in
terraform so we can create a whole stack
in a single command in just a single
terraformer play we can destroy the
whole thing using terraform destroy so
this is what it looked like so we
brought this up just to see what it
looked like and then we brought it
straight the heck back down because we
had no SSO and it was really scary so
all you got to do is you've got to enter
your account name your email address
your username and your password your
temporary password so here I created a
new account at twelve twelve twelve
minutes plus midday I put in my email
address and I put in my temporary
password that was at 12 minutes past
12:00 at 17 minutes past 12 I got an
email saying that my new account was
created so that's taking us from two
weeks down to five minutes
that's like four orders of magnitude I
think so some of the improvements we
want to make so like I said security so
we desperately need SSO on that website
that's scarier
Tech we want some UX stuff as well so at
the moment our our error codes are a bit
you know not helpful we've got a lot of
spinning wheels it takes about five
minutes for the account to create and
there's a spinning wheel for a lot of
that some provisioning features as well
so do we want users to have to have a
budget code before they can create an
account does the the cloud team need to
be informed when your accounts are
created what do we want to do about the
the organization's limits the service
limits so do we want a service ticket to
be raised automatically when we're
nearing the the service limits so that
takes me back to mh370 so this is one of
the first accounts that we created using
this new method and they've just they've
gone bonkers in this new account the
whole point of this is enablement so
we're getting the right tools the right
resources the compute resources the
storage in the hands of our smartest
people and then just letting them go at
it and they've gone off and they've done
a whole bunch of crazy work with EMR
with cytus doing incredible 3d
visualizations of the the seafloor off
the coast of w-a so IT is no longer a
blocker for us I t's really leading the
charge on getting the right tools in the
right hands Thanks
